reviewText: I spent... maybe a half hour playing. Didn't get passed the 80 seconds... and I want more of the same punishment. This game is awesome. Beautiful, smooth, ridiculously hard, but very fun. Each time I started over I got a little better, even if it was only by a second or 2.\n\nAmazing game.

reviewText: This game is ♥♥♥♥ing amazing. It has a great soundtrack, great visuals, and the gameplay is fantastic. The only problem with this game is that it's only fun in short bursts. I know that this is the second game, but an update with some extra stuff would be great. I'd recommend buying the UBERMOSH Collection, since it comes with the original UBERMOSH, the soundtrack, and UBERMOSH:BLACK, and it's only six bucks. People need this game in their life, it's a great time waster.
voteText: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful

reviewText: This has to be the most intense game on Steam. Every instance is loaded with a blur of Matrix worthy bullet dodging, endless pools of blood, and the thunder of the music pounding through your very soul. Finishing an event always ends with you on the edge of your seat, eyes locked to the screen, and your heart pumping adrenaline through you veins, as a rush of exhilaration comes over you at climax, with a victory so satisfying, you have to do it again.

reviewText: This game is the same as the first Ubermosh but better, I'ts alot more diffucult and makes you want to finish the game with 100% accheivment. reviewText: To me this is the Ubermosh's definitive edition. The colors looks more polished and the AI also improved. Liked the changes and maybe I didnt get to play the last version with controller, but this one actually supports it and makes the game even more enjoyable. Oh, also mobs are spawning a lot faster, so, it's even more hard core, watch out! 10/10

reviewText:
Pretty much like the first UBERMOSH if you played it.
A bit more difficult, not by much, but the achievements and the badges are a bit tougher.
One new class (same as No Class, less live, easier Brain Clap)
Brain Clap is a map clear that triggers after a a number of kills (around 60), makes the game easier.

Same pace, same guns (one new that is basically like the red one), same gameplay.
I beat it after less than an hour, like the first one. Worth 2$ if on sale.

reviewText:
Ubermosh: Black, brings you a new way to have the most action/fun game possible in 60 seconds.

- Perfect and smooth game-play
- Awesome achievements
- New set of skills
- Cool game Desing and colors
- Full controller support

Let's not forget about the soundtrack / sound effects. They put you inside one of the most brilliant indie games of 2016.

reviewText:
This is a really good fun game and I'd totally recommend you buying it, this is just criticism for calling this a more hardcore version" of UBERMOSH.

http://imgur.com/ND8CEcY - Hardboiled
http://imgur.com/Dyeb6d9
http://imgur.com/9dtyOse

I've gotten every single achievement in the game and 808 score as a max score on Catalyst mode and 607 on Kensai mode in under 27 minutes
date: and decided to do a couple of more runs on Hardboiled
recommended: which got me to 852 points in 33 minutes.\n\nThe new Brainclap hability was introduced into the game to make it more of a "hardcore" experience
voteText: however I think this went poorly
votesTotal: sometimes you're surrounded by enemies due to poor positioning
votesFunny: a wave of meteors come out of you simply by shooting this one guy
commentsCount:
eliminating any sort of punishment for letting yourself get into that situation.
I think that for the newer players looking for more of a challenge the original game would be more "hardcore".


Or maybe I'm just the blade saint :^)"
